sentences.english: He has been leading an ivory-tower existence.
sentences.chinese: 他可是一直过着象牙塔似的生活。

sentences.english: In turn scientists have retreated to their 'ivory towers', she said.
sentences.chinese: 她说，反过来，科学家退缩到了他们的“象牙塔”里。

sentences.english: Can we get out of the glass tower?
sentences.chinese: 我们能跳出那个象牙塔吗？

sentences.english: Students shouldn't be only bookworms on campus; they should be informed of what's going on in the world.
sentences.chinese: 学生不应只是象牙塔里的书虫，他们应该了解世事。

sentences.english: A university student taking a part-time job, in the words of some, is walking out of the ivory tower.
sentences.chinese: 大学生做兼职，用一些人的话说，就是走出象牙塔。

sentences.english: These are the perquisites designed to lure the brightest university graduates away from their ivory towers.
sentences.chinese: 这些额外的补贴都引诱前途光明的大学生走出象牙塔。

sentences.english: Perhaps he should have stepped down from the ivory tower and addressed concrete issues.
sentences.chinese: 或许，他本应该走出象牙塔，来解决更实际的问题。

sentences.english: It seems only one ivory tower has been stormed tonight.
sentences.chinese: 看来今晚一个象牙塔乖乖女形象将彻底颠覆。

sentences.english: Walked out of the Lu Xiaobing of the tower of ivory, the head is faced live cogently pressure.
sentences.chinese: 走出了象牙塔的鲁小冰，头一次面对切实的生存压力。

sentences.english: With the development of our society: the cfirmus no longer is a wonderful "Ivory Tower".
sentences.chinese: 随着社会的前进，除颐皲舍园没有再是一个象牙塔。

sentences.english: Living in the ivory tower is one thing, making a living in society is another.
sentences.chinese: 象牙塔中的生活与真实的社会是截然不同的两回事。

sentences.english: Scientists are becoming more willing to come out of their ivory towers.
sentences.chinese: 科学家正在变得越来越愿意走出他们的象牙塔。

definition: the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
the teeming world/the world of sensual pleasures
to pay no attention to outside matters
pinyin: liang3 er3 bu4 wen2 chuang1 wai4 shi4

definition: to yearn for/to look forward to
to waste time on worthless activities
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
